name: Cliff Briscoe

topics.topic_text: Want to play a hand of Caravan?
topics.response_text: A fellow enthusiast, huh? That's great! Let's play.

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerLoses
topics.response_text: Don't take it to heart. I've studied the strategies of the masters.

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerWins
topics.response_text: Huh. I wonder where I went wrong. Let's try that again.

topics.topic_text: I'm all done playing for now.
topics.response_text: Shucks, well, let's do it again sometime.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, let's play again.
topics.response_text: I've got a good feeling about this hand.

topics.topic_text: You don't have any offers for the rockets. You'd be lucky to get money at all.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Okay, I admit it. They've been collecting dust since before I got here. You can have them dirt cheap.

topics.topic_text: But... the price tag seems so excessive on the souvenir rockets. Could you make it lower?
topics.response_text: [FAILED] Are you kidding me? I can't ship these things fast enough. People love them!

topics.topic_text: I'd like to buy all of your remaining rocket souvenirs.
topics.response_text: Really? I never thought I'd see the day.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to buy a dinosaur souvenir.
topics.response_text: Great. Here you go!

topics.topic_text: I'd like to buy one of those souvenir rockets.
topics.response_text: Really? I mean, that's great! I'm sure you'll be quite pleased with it.

topics.topic_text: What about supplies? And guns? Do you sell those?
topics.response_text: Guns? I, uh, well... yeah, I guess I might have a few.

topics.topic_text: Jeannie May sent me.
topics.response_text: Bless her. Seems like every traveler I get in here tells me the same thing.

topics.topic_text: Just because.
topics.response_text: You just... did it? Just like that, on a whim?

topics.topic_text: I killed Jeannie May. Do I still get my discount?
topics.response_text: Ki- killed her? Why would you do something like that?

topics.topic_text: She missed my wake-up call.
topics.response_text: I- I'm sorry to hear that. She's a nice woman. Was. She might've grown on you.

topics.topic_text: That's my business.
topics.response_text: Lord almighty. I can't for the life of me imagine her doing anything that'd make someone want to kill her.

topics.topic_text: I'm not really sure it's safe to carry those things around.
topics.response_text: I understand if that's how you feel. But keep in mind that I've been selling these for years and I'm fine.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to see what you've got for sale.
topics.response_text: Sure thing. Have a look.

topics.topic_text: Jeannie May sent me.
topics.response_text: Bless her. Seems like every traveler I get in here tells me the same thing.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the rocket factory.
topics.response_text: Oh, that? It's just a bit west of Novac, up in the mountains. Lots of broken equipment and such. Place is deserted. Or used to be, I guess.

topics.topic: CliffBriscoeScienceRocketIs there radioactive material in your rocket souvenirs? It would explain the glow and the illnesses.
topics.topic_text: Is there radioactive material in your rocket souvenirs?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I, ah, well I don't really know. Would that sour you on buying one if it did?

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about the souvenir rockets.
topics.response_text: They're scale replicas of the real thing. Very detailed. Got a liquid in them that makes them glow.

topics.topic_text: What do you sell here?
topics.response_text: Well, there's t-rex figurines, of course. That's our bread and butter.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Welcome to the Dino Bite Gift Shop. My name's Cliff. If you're here for the t-rex figurines, you're just in time. There's still a few left.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the ghouls spotted to the west?
topics.response_text: I don't know what else I could tell you. You could give No-bark a try, though, or Jeannie May.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Boone's wife?
topics.response_text: Can't say we spoke much. Boone did most of the buying for them. She was in the store once, but she didn't stay long.

topics.topic_text: Come with me. There's something you should see, in front of the dinosaur.
topics.response_text: I guess I can leave the store for a minute. I hope I don't miss any customers.

topics.topic_text: How did they end up here?
topics.response_text: Well, they unloaded what they had left on the Dino Bite as a tax write-off. But that was before my time.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: {Cheery}That's a great idea.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for a man in a checkered coat. Have you seen anyone like that?
topics.response_text: Sure, but he didn't buy any souvenirs, if that's what you're wondering. Sounded like he didn't have his money with him.

description:
Cliff Briscoe is a 51 year-old African American Male.

Cliff Briscoe is the owner and operator of the Dino Bite gift shop in Novac. He maintains a close friendship with Jeannie May Crawford, the proprietor of the Dino Dee-lite Motel, and they mutually benefit from their relationship by directing customers to each other's establishments. Cliff is known for offering a discount to anyone who mentions Jeannie's name when making a purchase.

Cliff Briscoe's Personality: Cliff is friendly, business-savvy, and loyal to his friends. He has a pragmatic approach to life in the Mojave Wasteland, focusing on making a living while maintaining good relationships with the locals. He's not particularly adventurous but is generally helpful to those who treat him with respect.

Cliff Briscoe's Backstory: Cliff Briscoe grew up in the wasteland and has spent most of his life in and around Novac. Before establishing the Dino Bite gift shop, he worked various odd jobs around the town, eventually saving enough to purchase the small gift shop from its previous owner. Over the years, he has built a reputation for fair prices and friendly service, making him a well-respected member of the Novac community.
